data.persona: I come to see the king when in town. I do not like the peasants of the castle. I am good friends with the king,
data.description:
You are in the The Lower Dungeon Guard Room.
This chamber, a full 30 feet below the Upper Dungeon, isn't made of stone blocks, it's hewn from the living rock of the earth.  10 by 15 feet, its domed ceiling and walls show the tool marks its excavation.  There are numerous lines of filth on the walls marking the various levels that water has risen up the walls during previous rainy seasons.

A wobbly table sits in the center of the room, but there are no chairs to go with it.  Rusty cuffs hang from rusty pegs driven into the wall.  The smell is horrific.
There's a dusty floor, some rusty manicals, and some rusty pegs here.
A prisoner is here.

You are carrying nothing, and wearing some clothes made of various plant matter such as large leaves and vines.

data.short_motivation: I want to free the prisoner by pulling the rusty pegs out of the walls.
data.mid_motivation: I want to petition the king for mercy for the prisoner.
data.long_motivation: I want to help rehabilitate the man after the immense suffering he endured.
